member.name: T:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NNovControlHelpers
member.summary: Contains helper methods for NOV controls.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearBarcodeControl.Symbology
member.Summary:
Gets/Sets the symbology of this linear barcode.
Possible values are:
- Codabar: Codabar symbology.
- Code 11: Code 11 symbology.
- Code 39: Code 39 symbology.
- Code 39 Extended: Code 39 extended symbology.
- Code 93: Code 93 symbology.
- Code 128: Code 128 Auto symbology.
- Code 128A: Code 128 subset A symbology.
- Code 128B: Code 128 subset B symbology.
- Code 128C: Code 128 subset C symbology.
- EAN8: EAN8 symbology.
- EAN13: EAN13 symbology.
- FIM: Facing Identification Mark symbology.
- Interleaved 2of 5: Interleaved 2 of 5 symbology.
- ISBN: ISBN symbology.
- ITF14: ITF14 symbology.
- JAN13: JAN13 symbology.
- MS I_ 2 Mod 10: MSI 2 modulo 10 symbology.
- MS I_ Mod 10: MSI modulo 10 symbology.
- MS I_ Mod 11: MSI modulo 11 symbology.
- MS I_ Mod 1 1_ Mod 10: MSI modulo 11 / modulo 10 symbology.
- Pharmacode: Pharmaceutical Binary Code (Pharmacode) symbology.
- Post Net: PostNet symbology.
- Standard 2of 5: Standard 2 of 5 symbology.
- Telepen: Telepen symbology.
- UPCA: Universal Product Code A (UPCA) symbology.
- UPCE: Zero-suppressed Universal Product Code (UPCE) symbology.
- UP C_ Supplemental_ 2 Digit: UPC-2 symbology - a 2-digit supplement to the UPC used to indicate the edition of a magazine or periodical.
- UP C_ Supplemental_ 5 Digit: UPC-5 symbology - a 5-digit supplement to the UPC used to indicate suggested retail price for books.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearBarcodeControl.SizeMode
member.Summary:
Determines the way the barcode is sized in its slot.
Possible values are:
- Scale: The barcode size is calculated based on its Scale property.
- Fit: The barcode is drawn with such scale so that it fits the bounds of the widget (the Scale property is not taken into account).

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearBarcodeControl.WidgetScale
member.Summary: Gets/Sets the scale of the barcode. Valid only if the SizeMode is set to Scale.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearBarcodeControl.WidgetText
member.Summary: Gets/Sets the text encoded by this barcode.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearBarcodeControl.Visibility
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the widget visibility.
Possible values are:
- Visible: The element is visible and occupies layout space
- Hidden: The element is not visible, but occupies layout space
- Collapsed: The element is not visible and does not occupy layout space

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearBarcodeControl.Margins
member.Summary: Gets or sets the margins.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearBarcodeControl.HorizontalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Left: The content is aligned to the left side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Right: The content is aligned to the right side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized horizontally to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearBarcodeControl.VerticalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the vertical placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Top: The content is aligned to the top side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Bottom: The content is aligned to the bottom side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized vertically to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearBarcodeControl.ArrangeSlot
member.Summary: Gets or sets the arrange slot of the widget (in parent coordinates).

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearBarcodeControl.PreferredWidth
member.Summary: Gets or sets the suggested width of the element. If the value of this property is NaN the default width and desired width of the box are automatically computed. Otherwise both the default width and the desired width are equal to this value. By default set to NaN.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearBarcodeControl.PreferredHeight
member.Summary: Gets or sets the suggested height of the element. If the value of this property is NaN the default height and desired height of the box are automatically computed. Otherwise both the default height and the desired height are equal to this value. By default set to NaN.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearBarcodeControl.MinWidth
member.Summary: Gets or sets the minimal width of the element. The box default and desired width is always smaller or equal to this value, except in the case when the element is collapsed. By default set to 0.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearBarcodeControl.MinHeight
member.Summary: Gets or sets the minimal height of the element. The box default and desired height is always larger or equal to this value, except in the case when the element is collapsed. By default set to 0.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearBarcodeControl.IsDisabled
member.Summary: Gets whether this element is disabled. The local value of this property is automatically set to true, when the computed value of the Enabled property is false. The local value of this property is automatically cleared to its default false, when the computed value of the Enabled property is true. In this way you can select disabled widgets via styling, by using the ValueEqualsCondition

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearBarcodeControl.Id
member.Summary: Gets the id of the element, which uniquely identifies the element inside the owner document. It is automatically assigned when the element is registered in a document and is also automatically set to -1 when the element is unregistered from the document. You can manually assign the next document Id to the element, before it is added to a specific document, by using AssingNextId method.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearBarcodeControl.UserClass
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Class to which the element belongs. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to group related elements. An element can belong to more than one user classes that should be separated by the ' '(space) character. For example: element.UserClass = "MyClass1 MyClass2" specifies that element belongs to both MyClass1 and MayClass2 classes. The NUserClassCondtion styling condition lets you select elements of a specific user class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearBarcodeControl.UserId
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Id associated to this element. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to identify specific elements in the document. Unlike the Id property, the value of this property is not guaranteed to be unique in the document. The NUserIdCondition styling condition lets you select elements with a specific User Id.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearBarcodeControl.WidgetTag
member.Summary: Gets or sets the node tag, that can be any DOM compliant object. This property is not used by the node itself and is intended to provide users with the ability to attach custom data to the node. Attaching custom data to any node can also be achieved with the help of extendeded properties.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMatrixBarcodeControl.ErrorCorrection
member.Summary:
Gets/Sets the error correction level of this matrix barcode. Currently taken into account only by the QR Code barcode symbology.
Possible values are:
- Low: 7% of codewords can be restored.
- Medium: 15% of codewords can be restored.
- Quartile: 25% of codewords can be restored.
- High: 30% of codewords can be restored.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMatrixBarcodeControl.Symbology

Gets/Sets the symbology of this matrix barcode.
Possible values are:
- Data Matrix: Data Matrix symbology.
- Qr Code: QR Code symbology.
- Pdf 417: PDF 417 symbology.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NChartViewControl.IsDisabled
member.Summary: Gets whether this element is disabled. The local value of this property is automatically set to true, when the computed value of the Enabled property is false. The local value of this property is automatically cleared to its default false, when the computed value of the Enabled property is true. In this way you can select disabled widgets via styling, by using the ValueEqualsCondition

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NChartViewControl.Id
member.Summary: Gets the id of the element, which uniquely identifies the element inside the owner document. It is automatically assigned when the element is registered in a document and is also automatically set to -1 when the element is unregistered from the document. You can manually assign the next document Id to the element, before it is added to a specific document, by using AssingNextId method.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NChartViewControl.UserClass
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Class to which the element belongs. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to group related elements. An element can belong to more than one user classes that should be separated by the ' '(space) character. For example: element.UserClass = "MyClass1 MyClass2" specifies that element belongs to both MyClass1 and MayClass2 classes. The NUserClassCondtion styling condition lets you select elements of a specific user class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NChartViewControl.UserId
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Id associated to this element. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to identify specific elements in the document. Unlike the Id property, the value of this property is not guaranteed to be unique in the document. The NUserIdCondition styling condition lets you select elements with a specific User Id.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NChartViewControl.WidgetTag
member.Summary: Gets or sets the node tag, that can be any DOM compliant object. This property is not used by the node itself and is intended to provide users with the ability to attach custom data to the node. Attaching custom data to any node can also be achieved with the help of extendeded properties.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearGaugeControl.Visibility
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the widget visibility.
Possible values are:
- Visible: The element is visible and occupies layout space
- Hidden: The element is not visible, but occupies layout space
- Collapsed: The element is not visible and does not occupy layout space

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearGaugeControl.Margins
member.Summary: Gets or sets the margins.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearGaugeControl.HorizontalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Left: The content is aligned to the left side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Right: The content is aligned to the right side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized horizontally to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearGaugeControl.VerticalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the vertical placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Top: The content is aligned to the top side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Bottom: The content is aligned to the bottom side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized vertically to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearGaugeControl.ArrangeSlot
member.Summary: Gets or sets the arrange slot of the widget (in parent coordinates).

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearGaugeControl.PreferredWidth
member.Summary: Gets or sets the suggested width of the element. If the value of this property is NaN the default width and desired width of the box are automatically computed. Otherwise both the default width and the desired width are equal to this value. By default set to NaN.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearGaugeControl.PreferredHeight
member.Summary: Gets or sets the suggested height of the element. If the value of this property is NaN the default height and desired height of the box are automatically computed. Otherwise both the default height and the desired height are equal to this value. By default set to NaN.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearGaugeControl.MinWidth
member.Summary: Gets or sets the minimal width of the element. The box default and desired width is always smaller or equal to this value, except in the case when the element is collapsed. By default set to 0.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinearGaugeControl.MinHeight
member.Summary: Gets or sets the minimal height of the element. The box default and desired height is always larger or equal to this value, except in the case when the element is collapsed. By default set to 0.

The local value of this property is automatically cleared to its default false, when the computed value of the Enabled property is true. In this way you can select disabled widgets via styling, by using the ValueEqualsCondition

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NNumericLedDisplayControl.AllowFocus
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether this widget can be focused

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NNumericLedDisplayControl.AllowMouseCapture
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether this widget can capture the mouse

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NNumericLedDisplayControl.AllowTouchCapture
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether this element can capture the touch

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NNumericLedDisplayControl.WidgetAllowDrop
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether this widget can be used as the target of a drag-and-drop operation

member.Summary: Gets or sets the cursor

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NNumericLedDisplayControl.Tooltip
member.Summary: Gets or sets the tooltip

member.Summary: Gets/set the element interactor.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NNumericLedDisplayControl.Commander
member.Summary: Gets/set the element commander.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NNumericLedDisplayControl.WidgetTabStop
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether the element is included in the tab navigation or not

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NNumericLedDisplayControl.WidgetTabIndex
member.Summary: Gets or sets the index of the element in the tab navigation list.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NNumericLedDisplayControl.Id
member.Summary: Gets the id of the element, which uniquely identifies the element inside the owner document. It is automatically assigned when the element is registered in a document and is also automatically set to -1 when the element is unregistered from the document. You can manually assign the next document Id to the element, before it is added to a specific document, by using AssingNextId method.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NNumericLedDisplayControl.UserClass
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Class to which the element belongs. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to group related elements. An element can belong to more than one user classes that should be separated by the ' '(space) character. For example: element.UserClass = "MyClass1 MyClass2" specifies that element belongs to both MyClass1 and MayClass2 classes. The NUserClassCondtion styling condition lets you select elements of a specific user class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NNumericLedDisplayControl.UserId
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Id associated to this element. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to identify specific elements in the document. Unlike the Id property, the value of this property is not guaranteed to be unique in the document. The NUserIdCondition styling condition lets you select elements with a specific User Id.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NNumericLedDisplayControl.WidgetTag
member.Summary: Gets or sets the node tag, that can be any DOM compliant object. This property is not used by the node itself and is intended to provide users with the ability to attach custom data to the node. Attaching custom data to any node can also be achieved with the help of extendeded properties.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.WidgetContextMenu
member.Summary: Gets or sets the context menu builder which is responsible for creating context menus and popup-us for selected items.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.ViewportPadding
member.Summary: Gets or sets the padding applied to the viewport in which the drawing active page is displayed.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.FindTextSettings
member.Summary: Gets the text find settings

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.ReplaceTextSettings
member.Summary: Gets the text replace settings

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.SpellChecker
member.Summary: Gets the spell checker attached to the view.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.HScrollMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the scroll policy, which specifies the visibility of the H scrollbar
Possible values are:
- Never: The scrolling is never allowed.
- Always: The scrolling is always allowed.
- When Needed: The scrolling is allowed when needed.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.VScrollMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the scroll policy, which specifies the visibility of the Y scrollbar
Possible values are:
- Never: The scrolling is never allowed.
- Always: The scrolling is always allowed.
- When Needed: The scrolling is allowed when needed.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.NoScrollHAlign
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal content control alignment, when a horizontal scrollbar is not, or must not be displayed.
Possible values are:
- None: The viewport is not horizontally aligned. The viewport origin is used.
- Center: The viewport is horizontally inside the window.
- Left: The viewport left side is aligned to the window left side.
- Right: The viewport right side is aligned to the window right side.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.NoScrollVAlign
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the vertical content control alignment, when a vertical scrollbar is not, or must not be displayed.
Possible values are:
- None: The viewport is not vertically aligned. The viewport origin is used.
- Center: The viewport is vertically inside the window.
- Top: The viewport top side is aligned to the window top side.
- Bottom: The viewport bottom side is aligned to the window bottom side.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.SmallHScrollChange
member.Summary: Gets or sets the small H scroll change

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.SmallVScrollChange
member.Summary: Gets or sets the small V scroll change

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.Document
member.Summary: Gets or sets the document displayed by this view.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.ReadOnly
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether the user is able to modify the document visually.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.IsScrolling
member.Summary: Gets whether the viewport is currently being continuosly scrolled, either by dragging the scrollbar thumbs or by pressing the scrollbar arrows. Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.WindowX
member.Summary: Gets the window X coordinate. Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.WindowY
member.Summary: Gets the window Y coordinate. Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.WindowWidth
member.Summary: Gets the window Width. Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.WindowHeight
member.Summary: Gets the window Height. Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.WindowBackgroundFill
member.Summary: Gets or sets the background of the window area.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.Visibility
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the widget visibility.
Possible values are:
- Visible: The element is visible and occupies layout space
- Hidden: The element is not visible, but occupies layout space
- Collapsed: The element is not visible and does not occupy layout space

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.Margins
member.Summary: Gets or sets the margins.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.HorizontalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Left: The content is aligned to the left side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Right: The content is aligned to the right side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized horizontally to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.VerticalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the vertical placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Top: The content is aligned to the top side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Bottom: The content is aligned to the bottom side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized vertically to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.ArrangeSlot
member.Summary: Gets or sets the arrange slot of the widget (in parent coordinates).

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.PreferredWidth
member.Summary: Gets or sets the suggested width of the element. If the value of this property is NaN the default width and desired width of the box are automatically computed. Otherwise both the default width and the desired width are equal to this value. By default set to NaN.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.PreferredHeight
member.Summary: Gets or sets the suggested height of the element. If the value of this property is NaN the default height and desired height of the box are automatically computed. Otherwise both the default height and the desired height are equal to this value. By default set to NaN.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.MinWidth
member.Summary: Gets or sets the minimal width of the element. The box default and desired width is always smaller or equal to this value, except in the case when the element is collapsed. By default set to 0.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewControl.MinHeight
member.Summary: Gets or sets the minimal height of the element. The box default and desired height is always larger or equal to this value, except in the case when the element is collapsed. By default set to 0.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewWithRibbonControl.IsDisabled
member.Summary: Gets whether this element is disabled. The local value of this property is automatically set to true, when the computed value of the Enabled property is false. The local value of this property is automatically cleared to its default false, when the computed value of the Enabled property is true. In this way you can select disabled widgets via styling, by using the ValueEqualsCondition

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewWithRibbonControl.Id
member.Summary: Gets the id of the element, which uniquely identifies the element inside the owner document. It is automatically assigned when the element is registered in a document and is also automatically set to -1 when the element is unregistered from the document. You can manually assign the next document Id to the element, before it is added to a specific document, by using AssingNextId method.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewWithRibbonControl.UserClass
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Class to which the element belongs. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to group related elements. An element can belong to more than one user classes that should be separated by the ' '(space) character. For example: element.UserClass = "MyClass1 MyClass2" specifies that element belongs to both MyClass1 and MayClass2 classes. The NUserClassCondtion styling condition lets you select elements of a specific user class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewWithRibbonControl.UserId
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Id associated to this element. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to identify specific elements in the document. Unlike the Id property, the value of this property is not guaranteed to be unique in the document. The NUserIdCondition styling condition lets you select elements with a specific User Id.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDrawingViewWithRibbonControl.WidgetTag
member.Summary: Gets or sets the node tag, that can be any DOM compliant object. This property is not used by the node itself and is intended to provide users with the ability to attach custom data to the node. Attaching custom data to any node can also be achieved with the help of extendeded properties.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLibraryBrowserControl.LibraryViewType
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the type of view that needs to be used for viewing the libraries.
Possible values are:
- List: Small icons, text on the right
- Icons: Normal icons, text on the right
- Thumbnails: Large icons, text on the bottom

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLibraryBrowserControl.LibraryDisplayOrder
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the display order in which the libraries are viewed.
Possible values are:
- Default: Library items are displayed in their declaration order.
- Name Ascending: Library items are displayed in name ascending order.
- Name Descending: Library items are displayed in name descending order.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLibraryBrowserControl.Mode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the library browser mode.
Possible values are:
- View Libraries: View libraries.
- Search Libraries: Search libraries.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLibraryBrowserControl.HandleAutoConnect
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether the library browser handles the AutoConnect event of the drawing view.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLibraryBrowserControl.SearchManager
member.Summary: Gets the library info manager.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLibraryBrowserControl.Visibility
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the widget visibility.
Possible values are:
- Visible: The element is visible and occupies layout space
- Hidden: The element is not visible, but occupies layout space
- Collapsed: The element is not visible and does not occupy layout space

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLibraryBrowserControl.Margins
member.Summary: Gets or sets the margins.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLibraryBrowserControl.HorizontalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Left: The content is aligned to the left side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Right: The content is aligned to the right side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized horizontally to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLibraryBrowserControl.VerticalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the vertical placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Top: The content is aligned to the top side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Bottom: The content is aligned to the bottom side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized vertically to the respective content holder size.

member.Summary: Gets or sets the arrange slot of the widget (in parent coordinates).

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLibraryViewControl.HScrollMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the scroll policy, which specifies the visibility of the H scrollbar
Possible values are:
- Never: The scrolling is never allowed.
- Always: The scrolling is always allowed.
- When Needed: The scrolling is allowed when needed.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLibraryViewControl.VScrollMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the scroll policy, which specifies the visibility of the Y scrollbar
Possible values are:
- Never: The scrolling is never allowed.
- Always: The scrolling is always allowed.
- When Needed: The scrolling is allowed when needed.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLibraryViewControl.NoScrollHAlign
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal content control alignment, when a horizontal scrollbar is not, or must not be displayed.
Possible values are:
- None: The viewport is not horizontally aligned. The viewport origin is used.
- Center: The viewport is horizontally inside the window.
- Left: The viewport left side is aligned to the window left side.
- Right: The viewport right side is aligned to the window right side.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLibraryViewControl.NoScrollVAlign
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the vertical content control alignment, when a vertical scrollbar is not, or must not be displayed.
Possible values are:
- None: The viewport is not vertically aligned. The viewport origin is used.
- Center: The viewport is vertically inside the window.
- Top: The viewport top side is aligned to the window top side.
- Bottom: The viewport bottom side is aligned to the window bottom side.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLibraryViewControl.SmallHScrollChange
member.Summary: Gets or sets the small H scroll change

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLibraryViewControl.Id
member.Summary: Gets the id of the element, which uniquely identifies the element inside the owner document. It is automatically assigned when the element is registered in a document and is also automatically set to -1 when the element is unregistered from the document. You can manually assign the next document Id to the element, before it is added to a specific document, by using AssingNextId method.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLibraryViewControl.UserClass
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Class to which the element belongs. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to group related elements. An element can belong to more than one user classes that should be separated by the ' '(space) character. For example: element.UserClass = "MyClass1 MyClass2" specifies that element belongs to both MyClass1 and MayClass2 classes. The NUserClassCondtion styling condition lets you select elements of a specific user class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLibraryViewControl.UserId
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Id associated to this element. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to identify specific elements in the document. Unlike the Id property, the value of this property is not guaranteed to be unique in the document. The NUserIdCondition styling condition lets you select elements with a specific User Id.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLibraryViewControl.WidgetTag
member.Summary: Gets or sets the node tag, that can be any DOM compliant object. This property is not used by the node itself and is intended to provide users with the ability to attach custom data to the node. Attaching custom data to any node can also be achieved with the help of extendeded properties.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NPanAndZoomViewControl.SideWidth
member.Summary: Gets or sets the width of the viewport sides

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NPanAndZoomViewControl.CornerWidth
member.Summary: Gets or sets the width of the viewport corners

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NPanAndZoomViewControl.BandStroke
member.Summary: Gets/Sets the value of the BandStroke property.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NPanAndZoomViewControl.Visibility
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the widget visibility.
Possible values are:
- Visible: The element is visible and occupies layout space
- Hidden: The element is not visible, but occupies layout space
- Collapsed: The element is not visible and does not occupy layout space

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NPanAndZoomViewControl.Margins
member.Summary: Gets or sets the margins.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NPanAndZoomViewControl.HorizontalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Left: The content is aligned to the left side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Right: The content is aligned to the right side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized horizontally to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NPanAndZoomViewControl.VerticalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the vertical placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Top: The content is aligned to the top side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Bottom: The content is aligned to the bottom side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized vertically to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NPanAndZoomViewControl.ArrangeSlot
member.Summary: Gets or sets the arrange slot of the widget (in parent coordinates).

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NPanAndZoomViewControl.PreferredWidth
member.Summary: Gets or sets the suggested width of the element. If the value of this property is NaN the default width and desired width of the box are automatically computed. Otherwise both the default width and the desired width are equal to this value. By default set to NaN.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NPanAndZoomViewControl.PreferredHeight
member.Summary: Gets or sets the suggested height of the element. If the value of this property is NaN the default height and desired height of the box are automatically computed. Otherwise both the default height and the desired height are equal to this value. By default set to NaN.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NPanAndZoomViewControl.MinWidth
member.Summary: Gets or sets the minimal width of the element. The box default and desired width is always smaller or equal to this value, except in the case when the element is collapsed. By default set to 0.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NPanAndZoomViewControl.MinHeight
member.Summary: Gets or sets the minimal height of the element. The box default and desired height is always larger or equal to this value, except in the case when the element is collapsed. By default set to 0.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NPanAndZoomViewControl.IsDisabled
member.Summary: Gets whether this element is disabled. The local value of this property is automatically set to true, when the computed value of the Enabled property is false. The local value of this property is automatically cleared to its default false, when the computed value of the Enabled property is true. In this way you can select disabled widgets via styling, by using the ValueEqualsCondition

member.Summary: Gets or sets whether this element is enabled in the UI or not. If a local value has not been set to this property, its value will be inherited by an ancestor element.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NTreeGridViewControl.IsDisabled
member.Summary: Gets whether this element is disabled. The local value of this property is automatically set to true, when the computed value of the Enabled property is false. The local value of this property is automatically cleared to its default false, when the computed value of the Enabled property is true. In this way you can select disabled widgets via styling, by using the ValueEqualsCondition

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NTreeGridViewControl.Id
member.Summary: Gets the id of the element, which uniquely identifies the element inside the owner document. It is automatically assigned when the element is registered in a document and is also automatically set to -1 when the element is unregistered from the document. You can manually assign the next document Id to the element, before it is added to a specific document, by using AssingNextId method.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NTreeGridViewControl.UserClass
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Class to which the element belongs. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to group related elements. An element can belong to more than one user classes that should be separated by the ' '(space) character. For example: element.UserClass = "MyClass1 MyClass2" specifies that element belongs to both MyClass1 and MayClass2 classes. The NUserClassCondtion styling condition lets you select elements of a specific user class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NTreeGridViewControl.UserId
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Id associated to this element. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to identify specific elements in the document. Unlike the Id property, the value of this property is not guaranteed to be unique in the document. The NUserIdCondition styling condition lets you select elements with a specific User Id.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NTreeGridViewControl.WidgetTag
member.Summary: Gets or sets the node tag, that can be any DOM compliant object. This property is not used by the node itself and is intended to provide users with the ability to attach custom data to the node. Attaching custom data to any node can also be achieved with the help of extendeded properties.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NScheduleViewControl.WidgetContextMenu
member.Summary: Gets/Sets the context menu factory of the schedule view. If set to null, context menu will not be displayed.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NScheduleViewControl.NotificationCheckInterval
member.Summary: Gets/Sets the interval (in seconds) at which to check for notifications. By default set to 0, which means that the schedule will not check for and show any notifications.

member.Summary:
Gets or sets the widget visibility.
Possible values are:
- Visible: The element is visible and occupies layout space
- Hidden: The element is not visible, but occupies layout space
- Collapsed: The element is not visible and does not occupy layout space

member.Summary: Gets or sets the margins.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NScheduleViewControl.HorizontalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Left: The content is aligned to the left side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Right: The content is aligned to the right side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized horizontally to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NScheduleViewControl.VerticalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the vertical placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Top: The content is aligned to the top side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Bottom: The content is aligned to the bottom side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized vertically to the respective content holder size.

member.Summary: Gets or sets the arrange slot of the widget (in parent coordinates).

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NScheduleViewWithRibbonControl.IsDisabled
member.Summary: Gets whether this element is disabled. The local value of this property is automatically set to true, when the computed value of the Enabled property is false. The local value of this property is automatically cleared to its default false, when the computed value of the Enabled property is true. In this way you can select disabled widgets via styling, by using the ValueEqualsCondition

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NScheduleViewWithRibbonControl.Id
member.Summary: Gets the id of the element, which uniquely identifies the element inside the owner document. It is automatically assigned when the element is registered in a document and is also automatically set to -1 when the element is unregistered from the document. You can manually assign the next document Id to the element, before it is added to a specific document, by using AssingNextId method.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NScheduleViewWithRibbonControl.UserClass
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Class to which the element belongs. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to group related elements. An element can belong to more than one user classes that should be separated by the ' '(space) character. For example: element.UserClass = "MyClass1 MyClass2" specifies that element belongs to both MyClass1 and MayClass2 classes. The NUserClassCondtion styling condition lets you select elements of a specific user class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NScheduleViewWithRibbonControl.UserId
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Id associated to this element. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to identify specific elements in the document. Unlike the Id property, the value of this property is not guaranteed to be unique in the document. The NUserIdCondition styling condition lets you select elements with a specific User Id.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NScheduleViewWithRibbonControl.WidgetTag
member.Summary: Gets or sets the node tag, that can be any DOM compliant object. This property is not used by the node itself and is intended to provide users with the ability to attach custom data to the node. Attaching custom data to any node can also be achieved with the help of extendeded properties.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NRichTextViewControl.HScrollMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the scroll mode, which specifies the visibility of the H scrollbar
Possible values are:
- Never: The scrolling is never allowed.
- Always: The scrolling is always allowed.
- When Needed: The scrolling is allowed when needed.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NRichTextViewControl.VScrollMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the scroll mode, which specifies the visibility of the Y scrollbar
Possible values are:
- Never: The scrolling is never allowed.
- Always: The scrolling is always allowed.
- When Needed: The scrolling is allowed when needed.

member.Summary:
Gets or sets the widget visibility.

- Hidden: The element is not visible, but occupies layout space
- Collapsed: The element is not visible and does not occupy layout space

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NRichTextViewControl.Margins
member.Summary: Gets or sets the margins.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NRichTextViewControl.HorizontalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Left: The content is aligned to the left side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Right: The content is aligned to the right side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized horizontally to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NRichTextViewControl.VerticalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the vertical placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Top: The content is aligned to the top side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Bottom: The content is aligned to the bottom side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized vertically to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NRichTextViewControl.ArrangeSlot
member.Summary: Gets or sets the arrange slot of the widget (in parent coordinates).

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NRichTextViewControl.PreferredWidth
member.Summary: Gets or sets the suggested width of the element. If the value of this property is NaN the default width and desired width of the box are automatically computed. Otherwise both the default width and the desired width are equal to this value. By default set to NaN.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NRichTextViewControl.PreferredHeight
member.Summary: Gets or sets the suggested height of the element. If the value of this property is NaN the default height and desired height of the box are automatically computed. Otherwise both the default height and the desired height are equal to this value. By default set to NaN.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NRichTextViewControl.MinWidth
member.Summary: Gets or sets the minimal width of the element. The box default and desired width is always smaller or equal to this value, except in the case when the element is collapsed. By default set to 0.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NRichTextViewControl.MinHeight
member.Summary: Gets or sets the minimal height of the element. The box default and desired height is always larger or equal to this value, except in the case when the element is collapsed. By default set to 0.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NRichTextViewWithRibbonControl.Id
member.Summary: Gets the id of the element, which uniquely identifies the element inside the owner document. It is automatically assigned when the element is registered in a document and is also automatically set to -1 when the element is unregistered from the document. You can manually assign the next document Id to the element, before it is added to a specific document, by using AssingNextId method.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NRichTextViewWithRibbonControl.UserClass
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Class to which the element belongs. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to group related elements. An element can belong to more than one user classes that should be separated by the ' '(space) character. For example: element.UserClass = "MyClass1 MyClass2" specifies that element belongs to both MyClass1 and MayClass2 classes. The NUserClassCondtion styling condition lets you select elements of a specific user class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NRichTextViewWithRibbonControl.UserId
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Id associated to this element. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to identify specific elements in the document. Unlike the Id property, the value of this property is not guaranteed to be unique in the document. The NUserIdCondition styling condition lets you select elements with a specific User Id.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NRichTextViewWithRibbonControl.WidgetTag
member.Summary: Gets or sets the node tag, that can be any DOM compliant object. This property is not used by the node itself and is intended to provide users with the ability to attach custom data to the node. Attaching custom data to any node can also be achieved with the help of extendeded properties.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NButtonControl.WindowResult
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the dialog result
Possible values are:
- None: The result is undefined.
- OK: The OK button was clicked.
- Cancel: The Cancel button was clicked.
- Abort: The Abort button was clicked.
- Retry: The Retry button was clicked.
- Ignore: The Ignore button was clicked.
- Yes: The Yes button was clicked.
- No: The No button was clicked.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NButtonControl.ClickMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the click mode of the button
Possible values are:
- Press: The button is clicked when the button is pressed
- Release: The button is clicked when the button is released

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NButtonControl.IsPressed
member.Summary: Gets whether the button is pressed. Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NButtonControl.Visibility
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the widget visibility.
Possible values are:
- Visible: The element is visible and occupies layout space
- Hidden: The element is not visible, but occupies layout space
- Collapsed: The element is not visible and does not occupy layout space

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NButtonControl.Margins
member.Summary: Gets or sets the margins.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NButtonControl.HorizontalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Left: The content is aligned to the left side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Right: The content is aligned to the right side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized horizontally to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NButtonControl.VerticalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the vertical placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Top: The content is aligned to the top side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Bottom: The content is aligned to the bottom side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized vertically to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NToggleButtonControl.Id
member.Summary: Gets the id of the element, which uniquely identifies the element inside the owner document. It is automatically assigned when the element is registered in a document and is also automatically set to -1 when the element is unregistered from the document. You can manually assign the next document Id to the element, before it is added to a specific document, by using AssingNextId method.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NToggleButtonControl.UserClass
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Class to which the element belongs. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to group related elements. An element can belong to more than one user classes that should be separated by the ' '(space) character. For example: element.UserClass = "MyClass1 MyClass2" specifies that element belongs to both MyClass1 and MayClass2 classes. The NUserClassCondtion styling condition lets you select elements of a specific user class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NToggleButtonControl.UserId
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Id associated to this element. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to identify specific elements in the document. Unlike the Id property, the value of this property is not guaranteed to be unique in the document. The NUserIdCondition styling condition lets you select elements with a specific User Id.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NToggleButtonControl.WidgetTag
member.Summary: Gets or sets the node tag, that can be any DOM compliant object. This property is not used by the node itself and is intended to provide users with the ability to attach custom data to the node. Attaching custom data to any node can also be achieved with the help of extendeded properties.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NCalendarControl.SelectedDate
member.Summary: Gets or sets the selected date. When the selected date has changed the calendar automatically changes the ViewRange to DaysOfMonth, and navigates to the selected date. The current date also becomes the selected date.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NCalendarControl.CurrentDate
member.Summary: Gets or sets the current date. When the current date changes the calendar navigates the current view range to the current date, without changing the selected date.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NCalendarControl.ViewRange
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the current view range of the calendar.
Possible values are:
- Days of Month: Days of month view range.
- Months of Year: Months of year view range.
- Years of Decade: Years of decade view range.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NCalendarControl.CultureName
member.Summary: Gets or sets the name of the culture that should to be used when displaying this schedule. By default set to null, which means that the culture of the current thread will be used.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NCalendarControl.HeaderFormatString
member.Summary: Gets or sets the header format string, that defines the text representation of the current date, when the calender picker view range is set to days of months.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NCalendarControl.MonthFormatMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the format mode in which the month picker displays the months. By default set to AbbreviatedMonthName.
Possible values are:
- Month Number: Month number
- Month Number with Leading Zero: Month number with leading zero
- Abbreviated Month Name: Abbreviated Month Name (e.g. Dec)
- Full Month Name: Full month name (e.g. December)

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NCalendarControl.DayOfWeekFormatMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the format mode in which the day picker displays the days of the week. By default set to AbbreviatedDayName.
Possible values are:
- Abbreviated Day Name: The abbreviated day name (e.g. Sun)
- Full Day Name: The full day name (e.g. Sunday)

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NCalendarControl.HighlightToday
member.Summary: Determines whether to highlight today's date or not.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NCalendarControl.HeaderContentRelation
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the relation between the header and the content in the area of this widget.
Possible values are:
- Overlay: Specifies that header and content share the same space.
- Header above Content: Specifies that header is displayed vertically above content.
- Content above Header: Specifies that content is displayed vertically above header.
- Header before Content: Specifies that header is displayed horizontally before content.
- Content before Header: Specifies that content is displayed horizontally before header.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NCalendarControl.Spacing
member.Summary: Gets or sets the spacing between the header and content elemnets

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NCalendarControl.ContentPadding
member.Summary: Gets or sets the padding applied to the content element.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NCalendarControl.Visibility
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the widget visibility.
Possible values are:
- Visible: The element is visible and occupies layout space
- Hidden: The element is not visible, but occupies layout space
- Collapsed: The element is not visible and does not occupy layout space

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NHsbColorPickerControl.WidgetTabIndex
member.Summary: Gets or sets the index of the element in the tab navigation list.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NHsbColorPickerControl.Id
member.Summary: Gets the id of the element, which uniquely identifies the element inside the owner document. It is automatically assigned when the element is registered in a document and is also automatically set to -1 when the element is unregistered from the document. You can manually assign the next document Id to the element, before it is added to a specific document, by using AssingNextId method.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NHsbColorPickerControl.UserClass
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Class to which the element belongs. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to group related elements. An element can belong to more than one user classes that should be separated by the ' '(space) character. For example: element.UserClass = "MyClass1 MyClass2" specifies that element belongs to both MyClass1 and MayClass2 classes. The NUserClassCondtion styling condition lets you select elements of a specific user class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NHsbColorPickerControl.UserId
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Id associated to this element. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to identify specific elements in the document. Unlike the Id property, the value of this property is not guaranteed to be unique in the document. The NUserIdCondition styling condition lets you select elements with a specific User Id.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NHsbColorPickerControl.WidgetTag
member.Summary: Gets or sets the node tag, that can be any DOM compliant object. This property is not used by the node itself and is intended to provide users with the ability to attach custom data to the node. Attaching custom data to any node can also be achieved with the help of extendeded properties.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NHsbWheelColorPickerControl.SelectedColor
member.Summary: Gets or sets the selected color.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NHsbWheelColorPickerControl.UpdateWhileDragging
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether the selected color should be updated while the user drags the Hue or Saturation-Brightness selectors. If set to false the selected color is updated when the user releases the left mouse button. By default set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NHsbWheelColorPickerControl.HueSelectorSectorAngle
member.Summary: Gets or sets the sector angle of the hue selector, which defines the sector (arc) of the wheel occupied by the hue selector.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NHsbWheelColorPickerControl.HueWheelWidthPercent
member.Summary: Gets or sets the hue wheel width percent, which defines the width of the hue wheel relative to the hue wheel outer radius.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NHsbWheelColorPickerControl.HueSelectorExtendPercent
member.Summary: Gets or sets the extend of the hue selector pointers, measured as a percent of the hue wheel width.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NHsbWheelColorPickerControl.SBTriangleMarginsPercent
member.Summary: Gets or sets the margins applied to the SB triangle, measures as a percent of the hue wheel inner radius.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NHsbWheelColorPickerControl.SBSelectorRadiusPercent
member.Summary: Gets or sets the radius percent for the SB selector circle, measured as a percent of the hue wheel inner radius.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NHsbWheelColorPickerControl.Visibility
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the widget visibility.
Possible values are:
- Visible: The element is visible and occupies layout space
- Hidden: The element is not visible, but occupies layout space
- Collapsed: The element is not visible and does not occupy layout space

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NHsbWheelColorPickerControl.Margins
member.Summary: Gets or sets the margins.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NHsbWheelColorPickerControl.HorizontalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Left: The content is aligned to the left side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Right: The content is aligned to the right side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized horizontally to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NHsbWheelColorPickerControl.VerticalPlacement

Possible values are:

- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Bottom: The content is aligned to the bottom side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized vertically to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NComboBoxControl.SelectedIndex
member.Summary: Gets or sets the selected index. To deselect the currently selected item, set the SelectedIndex to -1.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NComboBoxControl.DropDownStyle
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the drop down style of the combo box.
Possible values are:
- Drop down: Specifies that the list is displayed by clicking the down arrow and that the text portion is editable. This means that the user can enter a new value and is not limited to selecting an existing value from the list.
- Drop down List: Specifies that the list is displayed by clicking the down arrow and that the text portion is not editable. This means that the user cannot enter a new value. Only values already in the list can be selected. This is the default style.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NComboBoxControl.HScrollMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal scroll mode of the popup list box.
Possible values are:
- Never: The scrolling is never allowed.
- Always: The scrolling is always allowed.
- When Needed: The scrolling is allowed when needed.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NComboBoxControl.VScrollMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the vertical scroll mode of the popup list box.
Possible values are:
- Never: The scrolling is never allowed.
- Always: The scrolling is always allowed.
- When Needed: The scrolling is allowed when needed.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NComboBoxControl.WheelNavigationMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the scroll mode of the combo box items. By default set to Always.
Possible values are:
- Always: The combo box always navigates through the items when the users rotates the mouse wheel over it.
- Never: The combo box never navigates through the items when the users rotates the mouse wheel over it.
- When Focused: The combo box navigates through the items when the users rotates the mouse wheel over it and the combo box is focused.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NComboBoxControl.DropDownButtonPosition
member.Summary:
Gets or sets position of the drop down button. By default set to right.
Possible values are:
- Right: The drop down button is positioned to the right of the drop down edit content.
- Bottom: The drop down button is positioned under the drop down edit content.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NComboBoxControl.WindowX
member.Summary: Gets or sets the window X coordinate. Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NComboBoxControl.WindowY
member.Summary: Gets or sets the window Y coordinate. Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NComboBoxControl.WindowWidth
member.Summary: Gets or sets the window Width. Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NComboBoxControl.WindowHeight
member.Summary: Gets or sets the window Height. Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NComboBoxControl.WindowBackgroundFill
member.Summary: Gets or sets the background of the window area.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NComboBoxControl.IsPopupOpened
member.Summary: Gets whether the hosted popup window is currently opened or not. The value of this property is automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NComboBoxControl.MaxPopupHeight
member.Summary: Gets or sets the maximum height of the popup window.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NComboBoxControl.MaxPopupWidth
member.Summary: Gets or sets the maximum width of the popup window.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NComboBoxControl.PopupXResize
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the X resizing of the popup.
Possible values are:
- Desired: The popup width/height is equal to its desired width/height
- Parent: The popup width/height is equal to the popup parent width/height
- Max of Desired and Parent: The popup width/height is the maximum of the popup parent width/height and the popup desired width/height.
- Min of Desired and Parent: The popup width/height is the minimum of the popup parent width/height and the popup desired width/height.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NComboBoxControl.PopupYResize
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the Y resizing of the popup.
Possible values are:
- Desired: The popup width/height is equal to its desired width/height
- Parent: The popup width/height is equal to the popup parent width/height
- Max of Desired and Parent: The popup width/height is the maximum of the popup parent width/height and the popup desired width/height.
- Min of Desired and Parent: The popup width/height is the minimum of the popup parent width/height and the popup desired width/height.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NComboBoxControl.PopupXPosition
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the X positioning of the popup relatively to this element screen bounds.
Possible values are:
- Automatic: The popup X position is automatically determined by the popup host.
- Left: The popup is displayed on the left side of the parent
- Right: The popup is displayed on the right side of the parent
- Align Lefts: Aligns the popup left side with the parent left side.
- Align Rights: Aligns the popup right side with the parent right side.
- Align Centers: Aligns the popup center with the parent center.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NComboBoxControl.PopupYPosition
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the Y positioning of the popup relatively to this element screen bounds.
Possible values are:
- Automatic: The popup Y position is automatically determined by the popup host.
- Up: The popup is displayed on the top side of the parent
- Down: The popup is displayed on the bottom side of the parent
- Align Tops: Aligns the popup top side with the parent top side.
- Align Bottoms: Aligns the popup bottom side with the parent bottom side.
- Align Centers: Aligns the popup center with the parent center.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NComboBoxControl.Id
member.Summary: Gets the id of the element, which uniquely identifies the element inside the owner document. It is automatically assigned when the element is registered in a document and is also automatically set to -1 when the element is unregistered from the document. You can manually assign the next document Id to the element, before it is added to a specific document, by using AssingNextId method.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NComboBoxControl.UserClass
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Class to which the element belongs. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to group related elements. An element can belong to more than one user classes that should be separated by the ' '(space) character. For example: element.UserClass = "MyClass1 MyClass2" specifies that element belongs to both MyClass1 and MayClass2 classes. The NUserClassCondtion styling condition lets you select elements of a specific user class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NComboBoxControl.UserId
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Id associated to this element. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to identify specific elements in the document. Unlike the Id property, the value of this property is not guaranteed to be unique in the document. The NUserIdCondition styling condition lets you select elements with a specific User Id.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NComboBoxControl.WidgetTag
member.Summary: Gets or sets the node tag, that can be any DOM compliant object. This property is not used by the node itself and is intended to provide users with the ability to attach custom data to the node. Attaching custom data to any node can also be achieved with the help of extendeded properties.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDateTimeBoxControl.SelectedDate
member.Summary: Gets or sets the currently selected date.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDateTimeBoxControl.CultureName
member.Summary: Gets or sets the name of the culture that needs to be used when displaying this calendar. If set to an empty string, the default culture is used.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDateTimeBoxControl.Mode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the date time format.
Possible values are:
- Date: Shows a calendar for picking a date.
- Time: Shows 3 numeric up/downs for picking hours, minutes and seconds.
- Date and Time: Shows a calendar and 3 numeric up/downs for picking time.
- Month and Year: Shows a combo box for selecting a month and a numeric up/down for selecting an year.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDateTimeBoxControl.Format
member.Summary: Gets or sets the date/time format string.

member.Summary: Determines whether a "Show Today" button is shown or not.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDateTimeBoxControl.HighlightToday
member.Summary: Determines whether to highlight today's date or not.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDateTimeBoxControl.DropDownButtonPosition
member.Summary:
Gets or sets position of the drop down button. By default set to right.
Possible values are:
- Right: The drop down button is positioned to the right of the drop down edit content.
- Bottom: The drop down button is positioned under the drop down edit content.

member.Summary: Gets or sets the maximum height of the popup window.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDateTimeBoxControl.MaxPopupWidth
member.Summary: Gets or sets the maximum width of the popup window.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDateTimeBoxControl.PopupXResize
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the X resizing of the popup.
Possible values are:
- Desired: The popup width/height is equal to its desired width/height
- Parent: The popup width/height is equal to the popup parent width/height
- Max of Desired and Parent: The popup width/height is the maximum of the popup parent width/height and the popup desired width/height.
- Min of Desired and Parent: The popup width/height is the minimum of the popup parent width/height and the popup desired width/height.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDateTimeBoxControl.PopupYResize

- Min of Desired and Parent: The popup width/height is the minimum of the popup parent width/height and the popup desired width/height.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuSplitButtonControl.Id
member.Summary: Gets the id of the element, which uniquely identifies the element inside the owner document. It is automatically assigned when the element is registered in a document and is also automatically set to -1 when the element is unregistered from the document. You can manually assign the next document Id to the element, before it is added to a specific document, by using AssingNextId method.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuSplitButtonControl.UserClass
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Class to which the element belongs. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to group related elements. An element can belong to more than one user classes that should be separated by the ' '(space) character. For example: element.UserClass = "MyClass1 MyClass2" specifies that element belongs to both MyClass1 and MayClass2 classes. The NUserClassCondtion styling condition lets you select elements of a specific user class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuSplitButtonControl.UserId
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Id associated to this element. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to identify specific elements in the document. Unlike the Id property, the value of this property is not guaranteed to be unique in the document. The NUserIdCondition styling condition lets you select elements with a specific User Id.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuSplitButtonControl.WidgetTag
member.Summary: Gets or sets the node tag, that can be any DOM compliant object. This property is not used by the node itself and is intended to provide users with the ability to attach custom data to the node. Attaching custom data to any node can also be achieved with the help of extendeded properties.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NBorderSplitButtonControl.SelectedValue
member.Summary: Gets or sets the selected value. The selected value is updated from the result of the drop down editing.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NBorderSplitButtonControl.HasAutomaticButton
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether the drop down shows an Automatic toggle button. When the button is checked, the selected value Automatic flag is raised to true. By default set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NBorderSplitButtonControl.HasNoneButton
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether the drop down shows a None toggle button. When the button is checked, the selected value is updated to the value provided by the GetNoneValue protected method. By default set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NBorderSplitButtonControl.HasMoreOptionsButton
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether the drop down shows a More Options button. By default set to true.

member.Summary: Gets or sets the image shown in the action button of this split button.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NBorderSplitButtonControl.MoreOptionsImage
member.Summary: Gets or sets the image shown in the "More Options..." button of the split button popup.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NBorderSplitButtonControl.DropDownButtonPosition
member.Summary:
Gets or sets position of the drop down button. By default set to right.
Possible values are:
- Right: The drop down button is positioned to the right of the drop down edit content.
- Bottom: The drop down button is positioned under the drop down edit content.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NBorderSplitButtonControl.IsPopupOpened
member.Summary: Gets whether the hosted popup window is currently opened or not. The value of this property is automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NBorderSplitButtonControl.MaxPopupHeight
member.Summary: Gets or sets the maximum height of the popup window.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NBorderSplitButtonControl.MaxPopupWidth
member.Summary: Gets or sets the maximum width of the popup window.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NBorderSplitButtonControl.PopupXResize
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the X resizing of the popup.
Possible values are:
- Desired: The popup width/height is equal to its desired width/height
- Parent: The popup width/height is equal to the popup parent width/height
- Max of Desired and Parent: The popup width/height is the maximum of the popup parent width/height and the popup desired width/height.
- Min of Desired and Parent: The popup width/height is the minimum of the popup parent width/height and the popup desired width/height.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NBorderSplitButtonControl.PopupYResize
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the Y resizing of the popup.
Possible values are:
- Desired: The popup width/height is equal to its desired width/height
- Parent: The popup width/height is equal to the popup parent width/height
- Max of Desired and Parent: The popup width/height is the maximum of the popup parent width/height and the popup desired width/height.
- Min of Desired and Parent: The popup width/height is the minimum of the popup parent width/height and the popup desired width/height.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NBorderSplitButtonControl.PopupXPosition
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the X positioning of the popup relatively to this element screen bounds.
Possible values are:
- Automatic: The popup X position is automatically determined by the popup host.
- Left: The popup is displayed on the left side of the parent
- Right: The popup is displayed on the right side of the parent
- Align Lefts: Aligns the popup left side with the parent left side.
- Align Rights: Aligns the popup right side with the parent right side.
- Align Centers: Aligns the popup center with the parent center.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NBorderSplitButtonControl.PopupYPosition
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the Y positioning of the popup relatively to this element screen bounds.
Possible values are:
- Automatic: The popup Y position is automatically determined by the popup host.
- Up: The popup is displayed on the top side of the parent
- Down: The popup is displayed on the bottom side of the parent
- Align Tops: Aligns the popup top side with the parent top side.
- Align Bottoms: Aligns the popup bottom side with the parent bottom side.
- Align Centers: Aligns the popup center with the parent center.

- Align Lefts: Aligns the popup left side with the parent left side.
- Align Rights: Aligns the popup right side with the parent right side.
- Align Centers: Aligns the popup center with the parent center.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NFillSplitButtonControl.PopupYPosition
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the Y positioning of the popup relatively to this element screen bounds.
Possible values are:
- Automatic: The popup Y position is automatically determined by the popup host.
- Up: The popup is displayed on the top side of the parent
- Down: The popup is displayed on the bottom side of the parent
- Align Tops: Aligns the popup top side with the parent top side.
- Align Bottoms: Aligns the popup bottom side with the parent bottom side.
- Align Centers: Aligns the popup center with the parent center.
