member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NFillSplitButtonControl.Id
member.Summary: Gets the id of the element, which uniquely identifies the element inside the owner document. It is automatically assigned when the element is registered in a document and is also automatically set to -1 when the element is unregistered from the document. You can manually assign the next document Id to the element, before it is added to a specific document, by using AssingNextId method.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NFillSplitButtonControl.UserClass
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Class to which the element belongs. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to group related elements. An element can belong to more than one user classes that should be separated by the ' '(space) character. For example: element.UserClass = "MyClass1 MyClass2" specifies that element belongs to both MyClass1 and MayClass2 classes. The NUserClassCondtion styling condition lets you select elements of a specific user class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NFillSplitButtonControl.UserId
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Id associated to this element. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to identify specific elements in the document. Unlike the Id property, the value of this property is not guaranteed to be unique in the document. The NUserIdCondition styling condition lets you select elements with a specific User Id.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NFillSplitButtonControl.WidgetTag
member.Summary: Gets or sets the node tag, that can be any DOM compliant object. This property is not used by the node itself and is intended to provide users with the ability to attach custom data to the node. Attaching custom data to any node can also be achieved with the help of extendeded properties.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NStrokeSplitButtonControl.PopupXResize
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the X resizing of the popup.
Possible values are:
- Desired: The popup width/height is equal to its desired width/height
- Parent: The popup width/height is equal to the popup parent width/height
- Max of Desired and Parent: The popup width/height is the maximum of the popup parent width/height and the popup desired width/height.
- Min of Desired and Parent: The popup width/height is the minimum of the popup parent width/height and the popup desired width/height.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NColorBoxControl.PopupYResize
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the Y resizing of the popup.
Possible values are:
- Desired: The popup width/height is equal to its desired width/height
- Parent: The popup width/height is equal to the popup parent width/height
- Max of Desired and Parent: The popup width/height is the maximum of the popup parent width/height and the popup desired width/height.
- Min of Desired and Parent: The popup width/height is the minimum of the popup parent width/height and the popup desired width/height.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NColorBoxControl.PopupXPosition
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the X positioning of the popup relatively to this element screen bounds.
Possible values are:
- Automatic: The popup X position is automatically determined by the popup host.
- Left: The popup is displayed on the left side of the parent
- Right: The popup is displayed on the right side of the parent
- Align Lefts: Aligns the popup left side with the parent left side.
- Align Rights: Aligns the popup right side with the parent right side.
- Align Centers: Aligns the popup center with the parent center.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NColorBoxControl.PopupYPosition
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the Y positioning of the popup relatively to this element screen bounds.
Possible values are:
- Automatic: The popup Y position is automatically determined by the popup host.
- Up: The popup is displayed on the top side of the parent
- Down: The popup is displayed on the bottom side of the parent
- Align Tops: Aligns the popup top side with the parent top side.
- Align Bottoms: Aligns the popup bottom side with the parent bottom side.
- Align Centers: Aligns the popup center with the parent center.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NColorBoxControl.PopupOpenDelay
member.Summary: Gets or sets the delay (in milliseconds) that must ellapse prior to deffered popup open.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NColorBoxControl.PopupCloseDelay
member.Summary: Gets or sets the delay (in milliseconds) that must ellapse prior to deffered popup close.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NColorBoxControl.Visibility
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the widget visibility.
Possible values are:
- Visible: The element is visible and occupies layout space
- Hidden: The element is not visible, but occupies layout space
- Collapsed: The element is not visible and does not occupy layout space

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NColorBoxControl.Margins
member.Summary: Gets or sets the margins.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NColorBoxControl.HorizontalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Left: The content is aligned to the left side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Right: The content is aligned to the right side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized horizontally to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NColorBoxControl.VerticalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the vertical placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Top: The content is aligned to the top side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Bottom: The content is aligned to the bottom side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized vertically to the respective content holder size.

member.Summary: Gets or sets the arrange slot of the widget (in parent coordinates).

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NColorBoxControl.PreferredWidth
member.Summary: Gets or sets the suggested width of the element. If the value of this property is NaN the default width and desired width of the box are automatically computed. Otherwise both the default width and the desired width are equal to this value. By default set to NaN.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NColorBoxControl.PreferredHeight
member.Summary: Gets or sets the suggested height of the element. If the value of this property is NaN the default height and desired height of the box are automatically computed. Otherwise both the default height and the desired height are equal to this value. By default set to NaN.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NColorBoxControl.MinWidth
member.Summary: Gets or sets the minimal width of the element. The box default and desired width is always smaller or equal to this value, except in the case when the element is collapsed. By default set to 0.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NColorBoxControl.IsDisabled
member.Summary: Gets whether this element is disabled. The local value of this property is automatically set to true, when the computed value of the Enabled property is false. The local value of this property is automatically cleared to its default false, when the computed value of the Enabled property is true. In this way you can select disabled widgets via styling, by using the ValueEqualsCondition

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NColorBoxControl.Id
member.Summary: Gets the id of the element, which uniquely identifies the element inside the owner document. It is automatically assigned when the element is registered in a document and is also automatically set to -1 when the element is unregistered from the document. You can manually assign the next document Id to the element, before it is added to a specific document, by using AssingNextId method.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NColorBoxControl.UserClass
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Class to which the element belongs. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to group related elements. An element can belong to more than one user classes that should be separated by the ' '(space) character. For example: element.UserClass = "MyClass1 MyClass2" specifies that element belongs to both MyClass1 and MayClass2 classes. The NUserClassCondtion styling condition lets you select elements of a specific user class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NColorBoxControl.UserId
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Id associated to this element. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to identify specific elements in the document. Unlike the Id property, the value of this property is not guaranteed to be unique in the document. The NUserIdCondition styling condition lets you select elements with a specific User Id.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NColorBoxControl.WidgetTag
member.Summary: Gets or sets the node tag, that can be any DOM compliant object. This property is not used by the node itself and is intended to provide users with the ability to attach custom data to the node. Attaching custom data to any node can also be achieved with the help of extendeded properties.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NGroupBoxControl.HeaderContentRelation
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the relation between the header and the content in the area of this widget.
Possible values are:
- Overlay: Specifies that header and content share the same space.
- Header above Content: Specifies that header is displayed vertically above content.
- Content above Header: Specifies that content is displayed vertically above header.
- Header before Content: Specifies that header is displayed horizontally before content.
- Content before Header: Specifies that content is displayed horizontally before header.

member.Summary: Gets or sets the spacing between the header and content elemnets

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NScrollContentControl.HScrollMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the scroll mode, which specifies the visibility of the horizontal scrollbar.
Possible values are:
- Never: The scrolling is never allowed.
- Always: The scrolling is always allowed.
- When Needed: The scrolling is allowed when needed.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NScrollContentControl.VScrollMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the scroll mode, which specifies the visibility of the vertical scrollbar.
Possible values are:
- Never: The scrolling is never allowed.
- Always: The scrolling is always allowed.
- When Needed: The scrolling is allowed when needed.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NScrollContentControl.NoScrollHAlign
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal content alignment, when a horizontal scrollbar is not, or must not be displayed.
Possible values are:
- None: The viewport is not horizontally aligned. The viewport origin is used.
- Center: The viewport is horizontally inside the window.
- Left: The viewport left side is aligned to the window left side.
- Right: The viewport right side is aligned to the window right side.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NScrollContentControl.NoScrollVAlign
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the vertical content alignment, when a vertical scrollbar is not, or must not be displayed.
Possible values are:
- None: The viewport is not vertically aligned. The viewport origin is used.
- Center: The viewport is vertically inside the window.
- Top: The viewport top side is aligned to the window top side.
- Bottom: The viewport bottom side is aligned to the window bottom side.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NScrollContentControl.SmallHScrollChange
member.Summary: Gets or sets the small horizontal scroll change.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NScrollContentControl.SmallVScrollChange
member.Summary: Gets or sets the small vertical scroll change.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NScrollContentControl.ViewportOriginX
member.Summary: Gets or sets the viewport origin X value, which is the point from the content coordinate system that is mapped to the window origin.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NScrollContentControl.ViewportOriginY
member.Summary: Gets or sets the viewport origin Y value, which is the point from the content coordinate system that is mapped to the window origin.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NScrollContentControl.ViewportOriginSnapToPixel
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether the viewport origin is snapped to exact pixel values. By default true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NScrollContentControl.IsScrolling
member.Summary: Gets whether the viewport is currently being continuosly scrolled, either by dragging the scrollbar thumbs or by pressing the scrollbar arrows. Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NScrollContentControl.IsDisabled
member.Summary: Gets whether this element is disabled. The local value of this property is automatically set to true, when the computed value of the Enabled property is false. The local value of this property is automatically cleared to its default false, when the computed value of the Enabled property is true. In this way you can select disabled widgets via styling, by using the ValueEqualsCondition

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NScrollContentControl.Id
member.Summary: Gets the id of the element, which uniquely identifies the element inside the owner document. It is automatically assigned when the element is registered in a document and is also automatically set to -1 when the element is unregistered from the document. You can manually assign the next document Id to the element, before it is added to a specific document, by using AssingNextId method.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NScrollContentControl.UserClass
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Class to which the element belongs. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to group related elements. An element can belong to more than one user classes that should be separated by the ' '(space) character. For example: element.UserClass = "MyClass1 MyClass2" specifies that element belongs to both MyClass1 and MayClass2 classes. The NUserClassCondtion styling condition lets you select elements of a specific user class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NScrollContentControl.UserId
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Id associated to this element. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to identify specific elements in the document. Unlike the Id property, the value of this property is not guaranteed to be unique in the document. The NUserIdCondition styling condition lets you select elements with a specific User Id.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NScrollContentControl.WidgetTag
member.Summary: Gets or sets the node tag, that can be any DOM compliant object. This property is not used by the node itself and is intended to provide users with the ability to attach custom data to the node. Attaching custom data to any node can also be achieved with the help of extendeded properties.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.Selection
member.Summary: Gets or sets the list box selection

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.IntegralVScroll
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether the vertical scrolling behavior is integral. When set to true the vertical scrollbar will scroll on descrete items, and its thumb will be sized to the count of currently visible items. When set to false the vertical scrollbar will work in smooth scrolling mode and its thumb will be sized to the currently visible space from the items area.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.HScrollMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the scroll mode, which specifies the visibility of the horizontal scrollbar.
Possible values are:
- Never: The scrolling is never allowed.
- Always: The scrolling is always allowed.
- When Needed: The scrolling is allowed when needed.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.VScrollMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the scroll mode, which specifies the visibility of the vertical scrollbar.
Possible values are:
- Never: The scrolling is never allowed.
- Always: The scrolling is always allowed.
- When Needed: The scrolling is allowed when needed.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.NoScrollHAlign
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal content alignment, when a horizontal scrollbar is not, or must not be displayed.
Possible values are:
- None: The viewport is not horizontally aligned. The viewport origin is used.
- Center: The viewport is horizontally inside the window.
- Left: The viewport left side is aligned to the window left side.
- Right: The viewport right side is aligned to the window right side.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.NoScrollVAlign
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the vertical content alignment, when a vertical scrollbar is not, or must not be displayed.
Possible values are:
- None: The viewport is not vertically aligned. The viewport origin is used.
- Center: The viewport is vertically inside the window.
- Top: The viewport top side is aligned to the window top side.
- Bottom: The viewport bottom side is aligned to the window bottom side.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.SmallHScrollChange
member.Summary: Gets or sets the small horizontal scroll change.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.SmallVScrollChange
member.Summary: Gets or sets the small vertical scroll change.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.ViewportOriginX
member.Summary: Gets or sets the viewport origin X value, which is the point from the content coordinate system that is mapped to the window origin.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.ViewportOriginY
member.Summary: Gets or sets the viewport origin Y value, which is the point from the content coordinate system that is mapped to the window origin.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.ViewportOriginSnapToPixel
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether the viewport origin is snapped to exact pixel values. By default true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.IsScrolling
member.Summary: Gets whether the viewport is currently being continuosly scrolled, either by dragging the scrollbar thumbs or by pressing the scrollbar arrows. Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.WindowX
member.Summary: Gets the window X coordinate. Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.WindowY
member.Summary: Gets the window Y coordinate. Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.WindowWidth
member.Summary: Gets the window Width. Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.WindowHeight
member.Summary: Gets the window Height. Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.WindowBackgroundFill
member.Summary: Gets or sets the background of the window area.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.Visibility
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the widget visibility.
Possible values are:
- Visible: The element is visible and occupies layout space
- Hidden: The element is not visible, but occupies layout space
- Collapsed: The element is not visible and does not occupy layout space

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.Margins
member.Summary: Gets or sets the margins.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.HorizontalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Left: The content is aligned to the left side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Right: The content is aligned to the right side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized horizontally to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.VerticalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the vertical placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Top: The content is aligned to the top side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Bottom: The content is aligned to the bottom side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized vertically to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.ArrangeSlot
member.Summary: Gets or sets the arrange slot of the widget (in parent coordinates).

member.Summary: Gets or sets the suggested width of the element. If the value of this property is NaN the default width and desired width of the box are automatically computed. Otherwise both the default width and the desired width are equal to this value. By default set to NaN.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.PreferredHeight
member.Summary: Gets or sets the suggested height of the element. If the value of this property is NaN the default height and desired height of the box are automatically computed. Otherwise both the default height and the desired height are equal to this value. By default set to NaN.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.MinWidth
member.Summary: Gets or sets the minimal width of the element. The box default and desired width is always smaller or equal to this value, except in the case when the element is collapsed. By default set to 0.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NListBoxControl.MinHeight
member.Summary: Gets or sets the minimal height of the element. The box default and desired height is always larger or equal to this value, except in the case when the element is collapsed. By default set to 0.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuBarControl.WidgetText
member.Summary: Gets or sets the name of the command bar. The name appears in the pendant menu and as title in the command bar floater.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuBarControl.Orientation
member.Summary:
Gets whether this is command bar is vertically arranged. By default set to false. Automatically updated by Nevron when this bar is added to a command bars lane.
Possible values are:
- Horizontal: Horizontal orientation.
- Vertical: Vertical orientation.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuBarControl.LanePosition
member.Summary: Gets or sets the preferred position of the bar inside the lane. It is specified relatively to the content area of the lane.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuBarControl.FillLane
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether the command bar fills the lane, when it is the only command bar inside it. When set to true the command bar cannot be dragged to a lane that contains other command bars and also other command bars cannot be dragged to the lane in which it resides. By default set to false.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuBarControl.StackFillMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the fill mode to apply on this command bar items. Valid only if this command bar is not wrappable ( set to false).
Possible values are:
- None: The stack does not attempt to fill the available area.
- Equal: The stack increases the items size with equal amounts to fill the available area.
- Proportional: The stack increases the items size with proportional amounts to fill the available area.
- First: The stack increases the items size in forward order until the stack fills the available area.
- Last: The stack increases the items size in reverse order until the stack fills the available area.
- Justify: The stack increases the spacing between the items to fill the available area.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuBarControl.StackFitMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the fit mode to apply on this command bar items. Valid only if this command bar is not wrappable ( set to false).
Possible values are:
- None: The stack does not attempt to fit the available area.
- Equal: The stack decreases the items size with equal amounts to fit the available area.
- Proportional: The stack decreases the items size with proportional amounts to fit the available area.
- First: The stack decreases the items size in forward order until the stack fits the available area.
- Last: The stack decreases the items size in reverse order until the stack fits the available area.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuBarControl.Wrappable
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether the command bar wraps its items or not when docked. When set to false the command bar will arrange the items in a single lane in command bar flow direction. When set to false the command bar will arrange the items in multiple lanes in command bar flow direction. When the bar is floating it is always wrappable. By default set to false.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuBarControl.HasHiddenItems
member.Summary: Gets whether the command bar has hidden items or not. Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuBarControl.AllowDock
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether this command bar can be docked or redocked, if it is floating. A command bar can always be redocked, if it is closed.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuBarControl.AllowFloat
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether this command bar can float, if it is docked. A command bar can always be refloated, if it is closed.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuBarControl.AllowClose
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether this command bar can be closed.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuBarControl.FloatingAnchor
member.Summary: Gets or sets the floating anchor, which is a point in local coordinates of the floating window header and is used to align the dragged floating window to the current mouse position. Automatically updated by Nevron when the user starts dragging the floater and reset when the user starts dragging the command bar in the dock.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuBarControl.FloatingWidth
member.Summary: Gets or sets the width of the floating window created for the command bar, when it is made to float. By default set to NaN, meaning that the window is automatically sized to fit the command bar content. The value of this property is updated when the user resizes the floating window by grabbing its sides. The height of the floating window is always automatically calculated.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuBarControl.RedockLaneRef
member.Summary: Gets or sets a reference to the lane, at which the command bar needs to be placed, when redocked. Automatically updated by Nevron, when the command bar starts to be dragged or was docked when closed.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuBarControl.RedockLanePosition
member.Summary: Gets or sets the offset part of the LanePosition, at which the command bar needs to be placed, when redocked. Automatically updated by Nevron, when the command bar starts to be dragged or was docked when closed.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuBarControl.RefloatLocation
member.Summary: Gets or sets the position of the floater window, at which to refloat the command bar. Automatically updated by Nevron, when the floater start to be dragged or was floating when closed.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuBarControl.ReopenMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the mode in which to reopen a closed command bar. Automatically updated by Nevron when the command bar is closed.
Possible values are:
- Redock: Redocks the bar.
- Refloat: Refloats the bar.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuBarControl.HasOpenedPopup
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether at least one of the menu bar items has its menu opened. The value of this property is automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuBarControl.OpenPopupsOnMouseIn
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether the popup windows of the command bar items are opened when the mouse enters them. By default set to false, meaning that you normally have to click a popup host to open its popup window.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuBarControl.ClosePopupsOnMouseOut
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether the popup windows of the command bar items should be automatically closed when the mouse is no longer inside them. By default set to false, meaning that the popup window will stay open, until another popup is shown, or the popup loses activation (e.g. user clicks away).

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuBarControl.Visibility
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the widget visibility.
Possible values are:
- Visible: The element is visible and occupies layout space
- Hidden: The element is not visible, but occupies layout space
- Collapsed: The element is not visible and does not occupy layout space

member.Summary: Gets or sets the margins.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuBarControl.UserClass
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Class to which the element belongs. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to group related elements. An element can belong to more than one user classes that should be separated by the ' '(space) character. For example: element.UserClass = "MyClass1 MyClass2" specifies that element belongs to both MyClass1 and MayClass2 classes. The NUserClassCondtion styling condition lets you select elements of a specific user class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NMenuBarControl.UserId
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Id associated to this element. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to identify specific elements in the document. Unlike the Id property, the value of this property is not guaranteed to be unique in the document. The NUserIdCondition styling condition lets you select elements with a specific User Id.

- Fit: The content is resized horizontally to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NPairBoxControl.BoxesRelation
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the pair box relation. By default set to Box1BeforeBox2.
Possible values are:
- Overlay: Specifies that box1 and box2 share the same space.
- Box 1 above Box 2: Specifies that box1 is displayed vertically above box2.
- Box 2 above Box 1: Specifies that box2 is displayed vertically above box1.
- Box 1 before Box 2: Specifies that box1 is displayed horizontally before box2.
- Box 2 before Box 1: Specifies that box2 is displayed horizontally before box1.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NPairBoxControl.FillMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the fill mode of the stack layout the 2 boxes are layouted with. Has effect only if BoxesRelation is not set to Overlay.
Possible values are:
- None: The stack does not attempt to fill the available area.
- Equal: The stack increases the items size with equal amounts to fill the available area.
- Proportional: The stack increases the items size with proportional amounts to fill the available area.
- First: The stack increases the items size in forward order until the stack fills the available area.
- Last: The stack increases the items size in reverse order until the stack fills the available area.
- Justify: The stack increases the spacing between the items to fill the available area.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NPairBoxControl.FitMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the fit mode of the stack layout the 2 boxes are layouted with. Has effect only if BoxesRelation is not set to Overlay.
Possible values are:
- None: The stack does not attempt to fit the available area.
- Equal: The stack decreases the items size with equal amounts to fit the available area.
- Proportional: The stack decreases the items size with proportional amounts to fit the available area.
- First: The stack decreases the items size in forward order until the stack fits the available area.
- Last: The stack decreases the items size in reverse order until the stack fits the available area.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NPairBoxControl.Spacing
member.Summary: Gets or sets the spacing between the boxes of this pair box.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NPairBoxControl.Visibility

- Collapsed: The element is not visible and does not occupy layout space

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDockPanelControl.UniformWidths
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the way in which the items are resized in the X dimension prior to being measured or arranged. By default set to None, which means that cells are initially having their desired widths.
Possible values are:
- None: The cells size in the respective dimension is not equal.
- Max: The cells size in the respective dimension is equal to the max of all cells.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDockPanelControl.UniformHeights
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the way in which the items are resized in the Y dimension prior to being measured or arranged. By default set to None, which means that cells are initially having their desired heights.
Possible values are:
- None: The cells size in the respective dimension is not equal.
- Max: The cells size in the respective dimension is equal to the max of all cells.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDockPanelControl.Id
member.Summary: Gets the id of the element, which uniquely identifies the element inside the owner document. It is automatically assigned when the element is registered in a document and is also automatically set to -1 when the element is unregistered from the document. You can manually assign the next document Id to the element, before it is added to a specific document, by using AssingNextId method.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDockPanelControl.UserClass
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Class to which the element belongs. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to group related elements. An element can belong to more than one user classes that should be separated by the ' '(space) character. For example: element.UserClass = "MyClass1 MyClass2" specifies that element belongs to both MyClass1 and MayClass2 classes. The NUserClassCondtion styling condition lets you select elements of a specific user class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDockPanelControl.UserId
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Id associated to this element. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to identify specific elements in the document. Unlike the Id property, the value of this property is not guaranteed to be unique in the document. The NUserIdCondition styling condition lets you select elements with a specific User Id.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NDockPanelControl.WidgetTag
member.Summary: Gets or sets the node tag, that can be any DOM compliant object. This property is not used by the node itself and is intended to provide users with the ability to attach custom data to the node. Attaching custom data to any node can also be achieved with the help of extendeded properties.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NStackPanelControl.FillMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the stack fill mode, which determines the fill behavior of the stack layout in the layout direction. By default set to ENStackFillMode.None.
Possible values are:
- None: The stack does not attempt to fill the available area.
- Equal: The stack increases the items size with equal amounts to fill the available area.
- Proportional: The stack increases the items size with proportional amounts to fill the available area.
- First: The stack increases the items size in forward order until the stack fills the available area.
- Last: The stack increases the items size in reverse order until the stack fills the available area.
- Justify: The stack increases the spacing between the items to fill the available area.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NStackPanelControl.FitMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the stack fit mode, which determines the fit behavior of the stack layout in the layout direction when the fill mode is set to none and there is not enough space for the layouted objects. By default set to ENStackFitMode.None.
Possible values are:
- None: The stack does not attempt to fit the available area.
- Equal: The stack decreases the items size with equal amounts to fit the available area.
- Proportional: The stack decreases the items size with proportional amounts to fit the available area.
- First: The stack decreases the items size in forward order until the stack fits the available area.
- Last: The stack decreases the items size in reverse order until the stack fits the available area.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NStackPanelControl.Direction
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the direction in which the layout arranges adjacent cells. By default set to TopToBottom.
Possible values are:
- Top to Bottom: The layout is directed vertically, starting from the top and expanding downwards.
- Bottom to Top: The layout is directed vertically, starting from the bottom and expanding upwards.
- Left to Right: The layout is directed horizontally, starting from the left and expanding to the right.
- Right to Left: The layout is directed horizontally, starting from the right and expanding to the left.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NStackPanelControl.HorizontalSpacing
member.Summary: Gets or sets the minimal horizontal spacing between the arranged items

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NStackPanelControl.VerticalSpacing
member.Summary: Gets or sets the minimal vertical spacing between the arranged items

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NStackPanelControl.UniformWidths
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the way in which the items are resized in the X dimension prior to being measured or arranged. By default set to None, which means that cells are initially having their desired widths.
Possible values are:
- None: The cells size in the respective dimension is not equal.
- Max: The cells size in the respective dimension is equal to the max of all cells.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NStackPanelControl.UniformHeights
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the way in which the items are resized in the Y dimension prior to being measured or arranged. By default set to None, which means that cells are initially having their desired heights.
Possible values are:
- None: The cells size in the respective dimension is not equal.
- Max: The cells size in the respective dimension is equal to the max of all cells.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NStackPanelControl.Visibility
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the widget visibility.
Possible values are:
- Visible: The element is visible and occupies layout space
- Hidden: The element is not visible, but occupies layout space
- Collapsed: The element is not visible and does not occupy layout space

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NStackPanelControl.Margins
member.Summary: Gets or sets the margins.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NStackPanelControl.HorizontalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Left: The content is aligned to the left side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Right: The content is aligned to the right side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized horizontally to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NStackPanelControl.VerticalPlacement

- Fit: The content is resized vertically to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NTableFlowPanelControl.MaxOrdinal
member.Summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of items in a single lane: - if the Direction is set to LeftToRight or RightToLeft, the MaxOrdinal specifies the column count. - if the Direction is set to TopToBottom or BottomToTop, the MaxOrdinal specifies the row count.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NTableFlowPanelControl.RowFillMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the mode in which the layout fills the available area in the rows dimension.
Possible values are:
- None: The stack does not attempt to fill the available area.
- Equal: The stack increases the items size with equal amounts to fill the available area.
- Proportional: The stack increases the items size with proportional amounts to fill the available area.
- First: The stack increases the items size in forward order until the stack fills the available area.
- Last: The stack increases the items size in reverse order until the stack fills the available area.
- Justify: The stack increases the spacing between the items to fill the available area.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NTableFlowPanelControl.RowFitMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the mode in which the layout fits into the available area in the rows dimension.
Possible values are:
- None: The stack does not attempt to fit the available area.
- Equal: The stack decreases the items size with equal amounts to fit the available area.
- Proportional: The stack decreases the items size with proportional amounts to fit the available area.
- First: The stack decreases the items size in forward order until the stack fits the available area.
- Last: The stack decreases the items size in reverse order until the stack fits the available area.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NTableFlowPanelControl.IsDisabled
member.Summary: Gets whether this element is disabled. The local value of this property is automatically set to true, when the computed value of the Enabled property is false. The local value of this property is automatically cleared to its default false, when the computed value of the Enabled property is true. In this way you can select disabled widgets via styling, by using the ValueEqualsCondition

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NTableFlowPanelControl.Id
member.Summary: Gets the id of the element, which uniquely identifies the element inside the owner document. It is automatically assigned when the element is registered in a document and is also automatically set to -1 when the element is unregistered from the document. You can manually assign the next document Id to the element, before it is added to a specific document, by using AssingNextId method.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NTableFlowPanelControl.UserClass
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Class to which the element belongs. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to group related elements. An element can belong to more than one user classes that should be separated by the ' '(space) character. For example: element.UserClass = "MyClass1 MyClass2" specifies that element belongs to both MyClass1 and MayClass2 classes. The NUserClassCondtion styling condition lets you select elements of a specific user class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NTableFlowPanelControl.UserId
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Id associated to this element. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to identify specific elements in the document. Unlike the Id property, the value of this property is not guaranteed to be unique in the document. The NUserIdCondition styling condition lets you select elements with a specific User Id.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NTableFlowPanelControl.WidgetTag
member.Summary: Gets or sets the node tag, that can be any DOM compliant object. This property is not used by the node itself and is intended to provide users with the ability to attach custom data to the node. Attaching custom data to any node can also be achieved with the help of extendeded properties.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NWrapFlowPanelControl.LaneFillMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the mode in which the layout tries to fill the extra space in each lane.
Possible values are:
- None: The stack does not attempt to fill the available area.
- Equal: The stack increases the items size with equal amounts to fill the available area.
- Proportional: The stack increases the items size with proportional amounts to fill the available area.
- First: The stack increases the items size in forward order until the stack fills the available area.
- Last: The stack increases the items size in reverse order until the stack fills the available area.
- Justify: The stack increases the spacing between the items to fill the available area.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NWrapFlowPanelControl.FillMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the mode in which the layout tries to fill the layout area, when the desired size of the generated lanes is smaller than the layout area.
Possible values are:
- None: The stack does not attempt to fill the available area.
- Equal: The stack increases the items size with equal amounts to fill the available area.
- Proportional: The stack increases the items size with proportional amounts to fill the available area.
- First: The stack increases the items size in forward order until the stack fills the available area.
- Last: The stack increases the items size in reverse order until the stack fills the available area.
- Justify: The stack increases the spacing between the items to fill the available area.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NWrapFlowPanelControl.FitMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the mode in which the layout tries to fit into the layout area, when the desired size of the generated lanes is larger than the layout area.
Possible values are:
- None: The stack does not attempt to fit the available area.
- Equal: The stack decreases the items size with equal amounts to fit the available area.
- Proportional: The stack decreases the items size with proportional amounts to fit the available area.
- First: The stack decreases the items size in forward order until the stack fits the available area.
- Last: The stack decreases the items size in reverse order until the stack fits the available area.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NWrapFlowPanelControl.Inverted
member.Summary: Gets or sets if the lanes are layouted from the first to the last (by default) or from the last to the first (inverted). By default set to false.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NWrapFlowPanelControl.Direction
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the direction in which the layout arranges adjacent cells. By default set to TopToBottom.
Possible values are:
- Top to Bottom: The layout is directed vertically, starting from the top and expanding downwards.
- Bottom to Top: The layout is directed vertically, starting from the bottom and expanding upwards.
- Left to Right: The layout is directed horizontally, starting from the left and expanding to the right.
- Right to Left: The layout is directed horizontally, starting from the right and expanding to the left.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NWrapFlowPanelControl.HorizontalSpacing
member.Summary: Gets or sets the minimal horizontal spacing between the arranged items

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NWrapFlowPanelControl.VerticalSpacing
member.Summary: Gets or sets the minimal vertical spacing between the arranged items

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NWrapFlowPanelControl.UniformWidths
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the way in which the items are resized in the X dimension prior to being measured or arranged. By default set to None, which means that cells are initially having their desired widths.
Possible values are:
- None: The cells size in the respective dimension is not equal.
- Max: The cells size in the respective dimension is equal to the max of all cells.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NWrapFlowPanelControl.UniformHeights
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the way in which the items are resized in the Y dimension prior to being measured or arranged. By default set to None, which means that cells are initially having their desired heights.
Possible values are:
- None: The cells size in the respective dimension is not equal.
- Max: The cells size in the respective dimension is equal to the max of all cells.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NWrapFlowPanelControl.Visibility
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the widget visibility.
Possible values are:
- Visible: The element is visible and occupies layout space
- Hidden: The element is not visible, but occupies layout space
- Collapsed: The element is not visible and does not occupy layout space

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NWrapFlowPanelControl.Margins
member.Summary: Gets or sets the margins.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NWrapFlowPanelControl.HorizontalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Left: The content is aligned to the left side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Right: The content is aligned to the right side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized horizontally to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NWrapFlowPanelControl.VerticalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the vertical placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Top: The content is aligned to the top side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Bottom: The content is aligned to the bottom side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized vertically to the respective content holder size.

member.Summary: Gets or sets the arrange slot of the widget (in parent coordinates).

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NWrapFlowPanelControl.PreferredWidth
member.Summary: Gets or sets the suggested width of the element. If the value of this property is NaN the default width and desired width of the box are automatically computed. Otherwise both the default width and the desired width are equal to this value. By default set to NaN.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NWrapFlowPanelControl.PreferredHeight
member.Summary: Gets or sets the suggested height of the element. If the value of this property is NaN the default height and desired height of the box are automatically computed. Otherwise both the default height and the desired height are equal to this value. By default set to NaN.

member.Summary: Gets or sets the minimal width of the element. The box default and desired width is always smaller or equal to this value, except in the case when the element is collapsed. By default set to 0.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NImageBoxControl.ImageRenderMode
member.Summary:
Gets/Sets the image render mode of this image box. By default set to Original, which renders the image as it is originally defined.
Possible values are:
- Original: The image is rendered as it is originally defined.
- Inverted Colors: The image is rendered with inverted colors.
- Inverted Brightness: The image brightnesss is inverted.
- Inverted Shades of Gray: The image is rendered with inverted shades of gray.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLabelControl.TextAlignment
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the text alignment
Possible values are:
- Top Left: Top left.
- Top Center: Top center.
- Top Right: Top right.
- Middle Left: Middle left.
- Middle Center: Middle center.
- Middle Right: Middle right.
- Bottom Left: Bottom left.
- Bottom Center: Bottom center.
- Bottom Right: Bottom right.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLabelControl.TextWrapMode
member.Summary:
Gets / sets the text wrap mode
Possible values are:
- Word Wrap: Text is wrapped inside the formatting rectangle
- Clip: Text outside the formatting rectangle is clipped
- Ellipsis: Text that lies outside the formatting rectangle is replaced with ellipsis

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLabelControl.IsDisabled
member.Summary: Gets whether this element is disabled. The local value of this property is automatically set to true, when the computed value of the Enabled property is false. The local value of this property is automatically cleared to its default false, when the computed value of the Enabled property is true. In this way you can select disabled widgets via styling, by using the ValueEqualsCondition

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLabelControl.Id
member.Summary: Gets the id of the element, which uniquely identifies the element inside the owner document. It is automatically assigned when the element is registered in a document and is also automatically set to -1 when the element is unregistered from the document. You can manually assign the next document Id to the element, before it is added to a specific document, by using AssingNextId method.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLabelControl.UserClass
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Class to which the element belongs. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to group related elements. An element can belong to more than one user classes that should be separated by the ' '(space) character. For example: element.UserClass = "MyClass1 MyClass2" specifies that element belongs to both MyClass1 and MayClass2 classes. The NUserClassCondtion styling condition lets you select elements of a specific user class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLabelControl.UserId
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Id associated to this element. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to identify specific elements in the document. Unlike the Id property, the value of this property is not guaranteed to be unique in the document. The NUserIdCondition styling condition lets you select elements with a specific User Id.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLabelControl.WidgetTag
member.Summary: Gets or sets the node tag, that can be any DOM compliant object. This property is not used by the node itself and is intended to provide users with the ability to attach custom data to the node. Attaching custom data to any node can also be achieved with the help of extendeded properties.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinkLabelControl.LinkUrl
member.Summary: Gets/Sets the URL associated with this link label. By default set to null.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NLinkLabelControl.IsVisited
member.Summary: Gets/Sets whether the link has been visited. Automatically set to true when the link is clicked. By default set to false.

member.Summary:
Gets or sets the text alignment
Possible values are:
- Top Left: Top left.
- Top Center: Top center.
- Top Right: Top right.
- Middle Left: Middle left.
- Middle Center: Middle center.
- Middle Right: Middle right.
- Bottom Left: Bottom left.
- Bottom Center: Bottom center.
- Bottom Right: Bottom right.

member.Summary: Gets or sets the symbol.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSymbolBoxControl.SymbolColorMode
member.Summary:
Determines whether the color of the symbol should change when the TextFill property of the button changes. This makes it easy to create symbol buttons with symbols whose color depends on the currently applied theme. By default set to OriginalSymbolColor.
Possible values are:
- Original Symbol Color: Default symbol color mode - symbol color is not changed.
- Text Fill: Symbol color is changed to that of the symbol box text fill.
- Text Fill when Disabled: Symbol color is changed to that of the symbol box text fill only when the symbol box is disabled.

Attaching custom data to any node can also be achieved with the help of extendeded properties.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NProgressBarControl.Mode
member.Summary:
Gets/Sets the progress bar mode. By default set to Determinate.
Possible values are:
- Determinate: Determinate mode (default).
- Indeterminate: Indeterminate mode.
- Buffered: Buferred mode.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NProgressBarControl.Style
member.Summary:
Gets/Sets the style of the progress bar.
Possible values are:
- Horizontal: A horizontally oriented rectangular progress bar.
- Vertical: A vertically oriented rectangular progress bar.
- Circular: A circular progress bar.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NProgressBarControl.LabelStyle
member.Summary:
Gets/Sets the progress label style.
Possible values are:
- Hidden: The label will not be shown.
- Value: The label will show the current value.
- Factor: The label will show the current value as a factor of the progress bar range, i.e. as a number from 0 to 1.
- Percent: The label will show the current value as a percent of the progress bar range, i.e. as a number from 0 to 100 followed by the '%' sign.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NProgressBarControl.BufferedValue
member.Summary: Gets/Sets the buffered value of the progress bar. Taken into account only when is set to .

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NProgressBarControl.RimWidthPercent
member.Summary: Gets/Sets the width of the rim of a circular progress bar relative to the radius of the circular progress bar. Taken into account only when is set to . By default set to 50%.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NProgressBarControl.IndeterminatePartSizePercent
member.Summary: Gets/Sets the size of the completed part when in Indeterminate mode in percents of the total progress bar length. By default set to 25%.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NProgressBarControl.AnimationSpeed
member.Summary: Gets/Sets the animation speed in Indeterminate mode in percents per second of the total progress bar length. By default set to 2%.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NProgressBarControl.Minimum
member.Summary: Gets or sets the range minimum.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NProgressBarControl.Maximum
member.Summary: Gets or sets the range maximum.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NProgressBarControl.Value
member.Summary: Gets or sets the value.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NProgressBarControl.Visibility
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the widget visibility.
Possible values are:
- Visible: The element is visible and occupies layout space
- Hidden: The element is not visible, but occupies layout space
- Collapsed: The element is not visible and does not occupy layout space

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NProgressBarControl.Margins
member.Summary: Gets or sets the margins.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NProgressBarControl.HorizontalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Left: The content is aligned to the left side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Right: The content is aligned to the right side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized horizontally to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NProgressBarControl.VerticalPlacement

- Bottom: The content is aligned to the bottom side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized vertically to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NProgressBarControl.IsDisabled
member.Summary: Gets whether this element is disabled. The local value of this property is automatically set to true, when the computed value of the Enabled property is false. The local value of this property is automatically cleared to its default false, when the computed value of the Enabled property is true. In this way you can select disabled widgets via styling, by using the ValueEqualsCondition

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NProgressBarControl.Id
member.Summary: Gets the id of the element, which uniquely identifies the element inside the owner document. It is automatically assigned when the element is registered in a document and is also automatically set to -1 when the element is unregistered from the document. You can manually assign the next document Id to the element, before it is added to a specific document, by using AssingNextId method.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NProgressBarControl.UserClass
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Class to which the element belongs. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to group related elements. An element can belong to more than one user classes that should be separated by the ' '(space) character. For example: element.UserClass = "MyClass1 MyClass2" specifies that element belongs to both MyClass1 and MayClass2 classes. The NUserClassCondtion styling condition lets you select elements of a specific user class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NProgressBarControl.UserId
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Id associated to this element. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to identify specific elements in the document. Unlike the Id property, the value of this property is not guaranteed to be unique in the document. The NUserIdCondition styling condition lets you select elements with a specific User Id.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSliderControl.IsDisabled
member.Summary: Gets whether this element is disabled. The local value of this property is automatically set to true, when the computed value of the Enabled property is false. The local value of this property is automatically cleared to its default false, when the computed value of the Enabled property is true. In this way you can select disabled widgets via styling, by using the ValueEqualsCondition

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSliderControl.Id
member.Summary: Gets the id of the element, which uniquely identifies the element inside the owner document. It is automatically assigned when the element is registered in a document and is also automatically set to -1 when the element is unregistered from the document. You can manually assign the next document Id to the element, before it is added to a specific document, by using AssingNextId method.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSliderControl.UserClass
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Class to which the element belongs. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to group related elements. An element can belong to more than one user classes that should be separated by the ' '(space) character. For example: element.UserClass = "MyClass1 MyClass2" specifies that element belongs to both MyClass1 and MayClass2 classes. The NUserClassCondtion styling condition lets you select elements of a specific user class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSliderControl.UserId
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Id associated to this element. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to identify specific elements in the document. Unlike the Id property, the value of this property is not guaranteed to be unique in the document. The NUserIdCondition styling condition lets you select elements with a specific User Id.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSliderControl.WidgetTag
member.Summary: Gets or sets the node tag, that can be any DOM compliant object. This property is not used by the node itself and is intended to provide users with the ability to attach custom data to the node. Attaching custom data to any node can also be achieved with the help of extendeded properties.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NNumericUpDownControl.DecimalPlaces
member.Summary: Gets or sets the number of digits shown after the decimal point. By default set to 0, which means that the numeric up down supports only whole numbers.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NNumericUpDownControl.Step
member.Summary: Gets or sets the value of the Step property. By default set to 1.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NNumericUpDownControl.DefaultSizeMeasureValue
member.Summary: Gets or sets a value that is used to measure the default size of the numeric up down.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NNumericUpDownControl.WheelIncDecMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the mode in which the numeric up down increases or decreases its value, when the user rotates the mouse wheel inside it. By default set to Always.
Possible values are:
- Always: The numeric up-down always increases/decreases the value when the users rotates the mouse wheel over it.
- Never: The numeric up-down never increases/decreases the value when the users rotates the mouse wheel over it.
- When Focused: The numeric up-down increases/decreases the value when the users rotates the mouse wheel over it and the numeric up-down is focused.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NNumericUpDownControl.TextSelectionMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets whether the caret will maintain its caret decimal position when updating the up down value with the up/down spinner
Possible values are:
- Reset on Change: Resets the position on value change
- Maintain Decimal Position: Maintains the relatieve decimal position of the caret on value change
- Select Text: Selects the text on value change

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NNumericUpDownControl.Orientation
member.Summary:
Gets or sets whether the increase/decrease buttons are horizontally or verticall arranged.
Possible values are:
- Horizontal: Horizontal orientation.
- Vertical: Vertical orientation.

member.Summary: Gets or sets the window X coordinate. Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.Summary: Gets or sets the margins.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NNumericUpDownControl.HorizontalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Left: The content is aligned to the left side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Right: The content is aligned to the right side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized horizontally to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NNumericUpDownControl.VerticalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the vertical placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Top: The content is aligned to the top side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Bottom: The content is aligned to the bottom side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized vertically to the respective content holder size.

member.Summary: Gets or sets the arrange slot of the widget (in parent coordinates).

member.Summary: Gets or sets the suggested width of the element. If the value of this property is NaN the default width and desired width of the box are automatically computed. Otherwise both the default width and the desired width are equal to this value. By default set to NaN.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSplitterControl.Orientation
member.Summary:
Specifies direction in which the splitter panes and thumb(s) are oriented. By default set to horizontal, which means that splitter panes and thumb(s) are placed from left to right.
Possible values are:
- Horizontal: Horizontal orientation.
- Vertical: Vertical orientation.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSplitterControl.ResizeWhileDragging
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether to resize the panes while the thumb is being dragged or not. When set to false the panes are resized when the thumb is released. By default set to false.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSplitterControl.ResizeStep
member.Summary: Gets or sets the step with which the current splitter position can be changed.

member.Summary: Gets or sets the margins.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSplitterControl.VerticalPlacement
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the vertical placement of the widget, relative to the arrange slot allocated to the box.
Possible values are:
- Top: The content is aligned to the top side of the content holder.
- Center: The content is aligned to the center of the content holder.
- Bottom: The content is aligned to the bottom side of the content holder.
- Fit: The content is resized vertically to the respective content holder size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSplitterControl.ArrangeSlot
member.Summary: Gets or sets the arrange slot of the widget (in parent coordinates).

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSplitterControl.PreferredWidth
member.Summary: Gets or sets the suggested width of the element. If the value of this property is NaN the default width and desired width of the box are automatically computed. Otherwise both the default width and the desired width are equal to this value. By default set to NaN.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSplitterControl.PreferredHeight
member.Summary: Gets or sets the suggested height of the element. If the value of this property is NaN the default height and desired height of the box are automatically computed. Otherwise both the default height and the desired height are equal to this value. By default set to NaN.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSplitterControl.MinWidth
member.Summary: Gets or sets the minimal width of the element. The box default and desired width is always smaller or equal to this value, except in the case when the element is collapsed. By default set to 0.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSplitterControl.MinHeight
member.Summary: Gets or sets the minimal height of the element. The box default and desired height is always larger or equal to this value, except in the case when the element is collapsed. By default set to 0.

member.Summary: Gets or sets the max width of the element

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSplitterControl.MaxHeight
member.Summary: Gets or sets the max height of the element

member.Summary: Gets the default width of the element (in parent coordinates). Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSplitterControl.DefaultHeight
member.Summary: Gets the default height of the element. (in parent coordinates) Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSplitterControl.DesiredWidth
member.Summary: Gets the desired width of the element (in parent coordinates). Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSplitterControl.DesiredHeight
member.Summary: Gets the desired height of the element. (in parent coordinates) Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.Summary: Gets the Width of the box (in local coordinates) Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSplitterControl.WidgetHeight
member.Summary: Gets the Height of the element (in local coordinates) Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSplitterControl.X
member.Summary: Gets or sets the X coordinate of the element box left-top corner in respect to the parent coordinate system.

member.Summary: Gets or sets the Y coordinate of the element box left-top corner in respect to the parent coordinate system.

member.Summary: Gets or sets the thickness of the box border sides.

member.Summary: Gets or sets the padding applied to the box content.

member.Summary: Gets or sets the background.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSplitterControl.WidgetFont
member.Summary: Gets or sets the font style.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSplitterControl.WidgetEnabled
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether this element is enabled in the UI or not. If a local value has not been set to this property, its value will be inherited by an ancestor element.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSplitterControl.IsDisabled
member.Summary: Gets whether this element is disabled. The local value of this property is automatically set to true, when the computed value of the Enabled property is false. The local value of this property is automatically cleared to its default false, when the computed value of the Enabled property is true. In this way you can select disabled widgets via styling, by using the ValueEqualsCondition

member.Summary: Gets or sets whether this widget can be focused

member.Summary: Gets or sets whether this widget can capture the mouse

member.Summary: Gets or sets whether this element can capture the touch

member.Summary: Gets or sets whether this widget can be used as the target of a drag-and-drop operation

member.Summary: Gets or sets the cursor

member.Summary: Gets/set the element interactor.

member.Summary: Gets/set the element commander.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSplitterControl.WidgetTabStop
member.Summary: Gets or sets whether the element is included in the tab navigation or not

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSplitterControl.WidgetTabIndex
member.Summary: Gets or sets the index of the element in the tab navigation list.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSplitterControl.Id
member.Summary: Gets the id of the element, which uniquely identifies the element inside the owner document. It is automatically assigned when the element is registered in a document and is also automatically set to -1 when the element is unregistered from the document. You can manually assign the next document Id to the element, before it is added to a specific document, by using AssingNextId method.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSplitterControl.UserClass
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Class to which the element belongs. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to group related elements. An element can belong to more than one user classes that should be separated by the ' '(space) character. For example: element.UserClass = "MyClass1 MyClass2" specifies that element belongs to both MyClass1 and MayClass2 classes. The NUserClassCondtion styling condition lets you select elements of a specific user class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSplitterControl.UserId
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Id associated to this element. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to identify specific elements in the document. Unlike the Id property, the value of this property is not guaranteed to be unique in the document. The NUserIdCondition styling condition lets you select elements with a specific User Id.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NSplitterControl.WidgetTag
member.Summary: Gets or sets the node tag, that can be any DOM compliant object. This property is not used by the node itself and is intended to provide users with the ability to attach custom data to the node. Attaching custom data to any node can also be achieved with the help of extendeded properties.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NCheckBoxControl.Indeterminate
member.Summary: Gets/Sets whether the check box is in an indetermined state, i.e. neighter checked, nor unchecked. By default set to false.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NCheckBoxControl.ClickOnSymbol
member.Summary: Gets/Sets whether the check box is toggled when the user clicks on the symbol only. By default set to false, which means that the check box is toggled when the user clicks either its symbol or its content.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NCheckBoxControl.SymbolContentRelation
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the symbol/content relation of this button.
Possible values are:
- Overlay: Specifies that the symbol and the content share the same space.
- Symbol above Content: Specifies that the symbol is displayed vertically above the content.
- Content above Symbol: Specifies that the content is displayed vertically above the symbol.
- Symbol before Content: Specifies that the symbol is displayed horizontally before the content.
- Content before Symbol: Specifies that the content is displayed horizontally before the symbol.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NCheckBoxControl.Spacing
member.Summary: Gets or sets the spacing between the symbol and the content.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NCheckBoxControl.Checked
member.Summary: Gets or sets the checked state of the toggle button.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NCheckBoxControl.ToggleCheckedOnClick
member.Summary: Determines whether to toggle the checked state of the toggle button when clicked. By default set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NCheckBoxControl.ClickMode
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the click mode of the button
Possible values are:
- Press: The button is clicked when the button is pressed
- Release: The button is clicked when the button is released

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NCheckBoxControl.IsPressed
member.Summary: Gets whether the button is pressed. Automatically updated by Nevron.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NCheckBoxControl.Visibility
member.Summary:
Gets or sets the widget visibility.
Possible values are:
- Visible: The element is visible and occupies layout space
- Hidden: The element is not visible, but occupies layout space
- Collapsed: The element is not visible and does not occupy layout space

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NCheckBoxControl.Margins
member.Summary: Gets or sets the margins.

For example: element.UserClass = "MyClass1 MyClass2" specifies that element belongs to both MyClass1 and MayClass2 classes. The NUserClassCondtion styling condition lets you select elements of a specific user class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NRadioButtonControl.UserId
member.Summary: Gets or sets the User Id associated to this element. This property is usually assigned by the user and is used to identify specific elements in the document. Unlike the Id property, the value of this property is not guaranteed to be unique in the document. The NUserIdCondition styling condition lets you select elements with a specific User Id.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.WinFormControls.NRadioButtonControl.WidgetTag
member.Summary: Gets or sets the node tag, that can be any DOM compliant object. This property is not used by the node itself and is intended to provide users with the ability to attach custom data to the node.
